data.title: Business in Malabo (Equatorial Guinea)
data.meta_description: Foreign Trade in Malabo: capital of Equatorial Guinea Bioko Island
data.text:
Doing Business in Malabo, Equatorial Guinea

Foreign Trade in Malabo: capital of Equatorial Guinea Bioko Island

Malabo is the capital of Equatorial Guinea (Central Africa) and the second largest city (250,000 malabeÃ±os)

Malabo is the commercial and financial centre of Equatorial Guinea.

Public administration, trade and services are the pillars of the economy of Malabo

Oil wells near the coast of Malabo

Main industry in Malabo: fishing industry

Main export products: cocoa and coffee

The headquarters of the Bank of Central African States are in Malabo.

Malabo is the capital of the Bioko North province

Study Online at EENI Global Business School

Equatorial Guinea Malabo

Masters: Business in Africa, Transport in Africa, International Business, Foreign Trade

Doctorates: African Business, World Trade, Global Logistics

More information: Business in Equatorial Guinea, at EENI Website.

Location of Malabo: North of Bioko Island

Main languages of Malabo: Fang (70% of malabeÃ±os), Bubi and Spanish

Main religion in Malabo: Christianity and the African Traditional Religions

Climate of Malabo: tropical and humid

Spain Cultural Centre of Malabo (CCEM)

Modern Art Museum of Equatorial Guinea

1827: foundation of Malabo (port Clarence) by the British

1855: Colonisation by the Spaniards, the capital Puerto Clarence is renamed to Santa Isabel. The capital of the Island of Fernando Poo becomes the capital of Spanish Guinea.

Its current name (Malabo) was given in 1973 as part of President Francisco MacÃ­as Nguema's campaign to replace the names of places of European origin with African proper names, in honour of Malabo Lopelo Melaka, the last King Bubi

Malabo = Santa Isabel (by the Spaniards)

Bioko North province (Malabo)

Population of the Bioko North province of Equatorial Guinea: 410,000 inhabitants

Area of the Bioko North province: 1,241 kmÂ².

Borders of the Bioko North province: Cameroon (North) and Gabon (South)

Bioko is located to 50 kilometres from the Cameroonian coast.

The two districts of the Bioko North province are:

Baney

Malabo

Transport and Logistics in Malabo (Equatorial Guinea)

During the rainy season, Roads are often impassable without a vehicle with four-wheel drive.

Project to improve paved roads from Malabo to Luba and Riaba

The port of Malabo has road links to the ports of Douala (Cameroon) and Bata

Malabo-Santa Isabel Airport

National University of Equatorial Guinea
